header_summary:
Brandon Black has proposed enhancements to the Partially Signed Bitcoin Transaction (PSBT) format, suggesting the addition of two new global types: PSBT_GLOBAL_DESCRIPTOR and PSBT_GLOBAL_KEY_NAME, to standardize the transaction process. The PSBT_GLOBAL_DESCRIPTOR would encode a descriptor with a "|" key, while PSBT_GLOBAL_KEY_NAME would pair "<keyname>" with its respective value, improving device coordination and the signing process in Bitcoin transactions.

In another development, Michael Ford has announced the release of Bitcoin Core's latest release candidate, version v26.0rc3, which is available for download from the official website or can be verified via a signed tag on GitHub. Accompanying the binaries are preliminary release notes on GitHub, with this version serving as an important step towards the official v26.0 release of Bitcoin Core, pending community testing and the absence of critical issues.

recent_posts.title: A proposal for a "PSBT for descriptors" format
recent_posts.summary:
- Brandon Black suggests enhancing PSBT to easily convert to a valid format.
- He proposes adding two new global types to BIP174 for standardization.
- These changes would streamline interactions between coordinating and signing devices.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 26.0 release candidate 3 available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v26.0rc3 is now available for download on the official website.
- The source code is verifiable on GitHub with preliminary release notes for changes.
- If no critical issues are found, this candidate will become the official v26.0 release.

active_posts.title: A proposal for a "PSBT for descriptors" format
active_posts.summary:
- SeedHammer is developing a compact metal backup descriptor using PSBT encoding.
- The descriptor follows BIP standards but elicits debate over CBOR versus PSBT methods.
- Feedback is requested before formalizing the proposal through the BIP process.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 26.0 release candidate 3 available
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's version v26.0rc3 is now available for download.
- Preliminary release notes detailing changes are accessible on GitHub.
- Absence of critical issues will promote v26.0rc3 to the official v26.0 release.

active_posts.title: Mailing List Future
active_posts.summary:
- The recent meeting discussed the closure of our mailing list and alternative platforms.
- Several options, including Google Groups and GitHub, were reviewed with their challenges.
- A vote on the new platform is set for the next meeting, with input invited beforehand.

active_posts.title: Liquidity Ads and griefing subtleties
active_posts.summary:
- Liquidity ads present pricing challenges and risks for griefing attacks in protocol design.
- Proposed solutions, such as CLTV, entail complexities and could disadvantage sellers.
- Integrating liquidity marketplaces is key, despite necessary risk management by sellers.
